result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah M Lemmon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Theft by Acquisition, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(3)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:14 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Roeth recites agreement, defendant will plea to counts 3 & 4 with probation.  State concurs and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 3 & 4.  Court orders counts 1,2,5 & 6 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 3 - 180 days county jail.  Court grants the defendant 89 days of sentence credit.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.

-Court costs.
-DNA Sample


COUNT 4 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $1,522.34
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:28 a.m.

Note:  After court - judge said sentence to commence immediately.
